items.title: Niagara Falls KOA Holiday
items.description: Located just minutes from the majestic Niagara Falls, this campground offers a peaceful retreat with amenities such as outdoor and indoor heated pools, an outdoor cinema, and a camp store. It's an ideal spot for families and nature enthusiasts seeking relaxation

items.title: Four Mile Creek State Park
items.description: Situated on the shores of Lake Ontario, this park provides a serene environment with picnic tables, nature trails, and a campground with tent and trailer sites. It's perfect for those looking to unwind amidst natural beauty

items.title: Rattlesnake Point Conservation Area
items.description: Located in Milton, this conservation area offers tranquil hiking trails along the Niagara Escarpment, with opportunities for picnicking and camping. It's a peaceful spot for nature lovers.

items.title: Rock Point Provincial Park
items.description: Situated on the shore of Lake Erie, this park offers a quiet camping experience with opportunities for fishing, hiking, and picnicking. It's a great place to relax and enjoy the natural surroundings.​

items.title: Kelso Conservation Area
items.description: Located near Milton, this area offers camping, hiking, mountain biking, and boating on Lake Kelso. It's a hub for outdoor adventures

items.title: Short Hills Provincial Park
items.description: Known for its rugged terrain and diverse trails, this park is ideal for hiking and mountain biking enthusiasts seeking an adventurous experience.​

items.title: Mono Cliffs Provincial Park
items.description: This park features challenging hiking trails along the Niagara Escarpment, offering scenic views and diverse ecosystems for adventure seekers.

items.title: Niagara Glen Nature Reserve
items.description: Located near Niagara Falls, this reserve offers hiking trails through a unique geological landscape, providing an adventurous experience amidst lush vegetation.​

items.title: Niagara Falls State Park
items.description: As America's oldest state park, it offers historical exhibits, picnic areas, and proximity to the iconic Niagara Falls, providing a rich cultural experience.

items.title: Old Fort Niagara
items.description: Located in Youngstown, this historic fort dates back to the 18th century and offers guided tours, reenactments, and a glimpse into the area's military history.​

items.title: Bruce Peninsula National Park
items.description: This national park features historical sites, including the historic lighthouse at Cape Hurd, and offers cultural experiences alongside natural beauty.

items.title: Fort George National Historic Site
items.description: Located in Niagara-on-the-Lake, this fort played a significant role in the War of 1812 and offers guided tours and historical reenactments.

items.title: Queenston Heights Park
items.description: This park offers panoramic views of the Niagara River and surrounding landscapes, along with historical monuments and picnic areas.​

items.title: Niagara Parkway
items.description: A scenic drive that runs along the Niagara River, offering numerous lookout points, picnic areas, and access to attractions like the Butterfly Conservatory.​

items.title: Mount Nemo Conservation Area
items.description: Located in Burlington, this area offers hiking trails with scenic views of the surrounding countryside and the Niagara Escarpment.​

items.title: Niagara Escarpment
items.description: A UNESCO World Biosphere Reserve offering numerous trails and lookouts with breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes.​
